content:
You are correct that in order to calculate the volume of a three-dimensional object, you must use its dimensions in cubic units. In this case, since you are trying to find the volume of the microwave in cubic inches, you will need to use the dimensions of the microwave in inches.

To calculate the volume of the microwave in cubic inches, you can use the formula:

Volume (V) = Length (l) x Width (w) x Height (h)

If the length, width, and height of the microwave are 14 inches, 20.5 inches, and 10.25 inches, respectively, you can calculate the volume as follows:

V = 14 x 20.5 x 10.25 = 2962 cubic inches

Thus, the volume of the microwave is approximately 2962 cubic inches.

I apologize for any confusion my previous responses may have caused. I hope this helps clarify the calculation. If you have any additional questions, please don't hesitate to ask.
